scenarioDescription:
The HD 85390 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 85390 is a star with 0.76 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 109.34 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 85390 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 85390 system


HD 85390 b

HD 85390 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2011-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.37 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 85390 b is 31.482 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 85390 b is 6.160 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 85390 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 85390, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 85390 - System With 1 Exoplanet
